title: If X follows a Poisson distribution with parameter lambda, what is the value of E (ax+b)? - Quora

response.answer_text: a is a constant here, b is a constant here, and X is a random variable following Poisson distribution with parameter λ. So just apply the formula for expectation. E(X)= λ as we know that in case of Poisson distribution expectation is just the parameter. E(aX) = a.E(X)= aλ and E(aX+b) = aλ+b
Just an application of basic propertites of “Expectation” and “Poisson distribution” E(ax+b)=aE(x)+b =aλ+b [If a random variable X~P(λ), the expectation of X i.e E(X)=λ  ]
